update.description: The `sdf::readFile` and `sdf::readString` functions all automatically convert an sdf file to the latest version. With the large changes in sdf 1.7, it is nice to be able to load a file without converting it forward. This adds `readFile` and `readString` overloads to parser.hh that have a boolean argument for whether to conver to the latest version or not.
update.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

pull_request.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

content.raw: we could make an internal function in `parser.cc` that has the API `readFile(const std::string &, SDFPtr, const bool, Errors &)` and the other functions could call it. I think we an do it without duplicating code; let me try
content.html: we could make an internal function in parser.cc that has the API readFile(const std::string &, SDFPtr, const bool, Errors &) and the other functions could call it. I think we an do it without duplicating code; let me try

pull_request.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

pullrequest.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

content.raw: The downside of making a new function is that we'd have to repeat some code. For example, `bool readFile(const std::string &_filename, SDFPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors)` used to actually load the file before calling `readDoc`. If I understand correctly, making `sdf::readFileWithoutConversion` would need the same file loading code before calling `readDoc`. I think it would be better to have an overload than to repeat code.
content.html: The downside of making a new function is that we'd have to repeat some code. For example, bool readFile(const std::string &_filename, SDFPtr _sdf, Errors &_errors) used to actually load the file before calling readDoc. If I understand correctly, making sdf::readFileWithoutConversion would need the same file loading code before calling readDoc. I think it would be better to have an overload than to repeat code.

content.raw:
Per this conversion, it may have been nicer to send raw text over, but this is a more practical solution for the time being.

Request here is to have DOM Parsing fail if the SDFElement’s SDFormat version is not exactly the current version.
content.html:
Per this conversion, it may have been nicer to send raw text over, but this is a more practical solution for the time being.

Request here is to have DOM Parsing fail if the SDFElement’s SDFormat version is not exactly the current version.

pull_request.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

pullrequest.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

content.raw:
this is useful for legacy support, but it's also useful for a multi-stage loading process such as the one used in gazebo for loading models from the gzclient GUI:

* gzclient uses `sdf::readFile` to an xml document in memory
* gzclient serializes the document to a string and sends it over transport
* gzserver receives the string and uses `sdf::readString`

in the process of serialization, the original sdf version was lost, so allowing `sdf::readFile` to skip conversion is useful in this workflow
content.html:
this is useful for legacy support, but it's also useful for a multi-stage loading process such as the one used in gazebo for loading models from the gzclient GUI:

  • gzclient uses sdf::readFile to an xml document in memory
  • gzclient serializes the document to a string and sends it over transport
  • gzserver receives the string and uses sdf::readString

in the process of serialization, the original sdf version was lost, so allowing sdf::readFile to skip conversion is useful in this workflow

pull_request.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

pullrequest.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

content.raw:
I’m not sure if I understand the ramifications of this…

Is this flag only really useful if you’re not using the DOM? \(e.g. Gazebo Classic?\)

If you’re using the DOM, then not converting seems like it could hurt you? \(in that the DOM parsing would fail?\)
content.html:
I’m not sure if I understand the ramifications of this…

Is this flag only really useful if you’re not using the DOM? (e.g. Gazebo Classic?)

If you’re using the DOM, then not converting seems like it could hurt you? (in that the DOM parsing would fail?)
